1.title: Preheat Equipment and Cup
1.description: Flush a blank shot of hot water through your espresso machine and into your cup to preheat everything. This ensures the 30ml shot stays hot and maintains crema.

2.title: Grind and Dose
2.description: Grind fresh coffee to a fine consistency, using 7–9g of coffee. Weigh your coffee after grinding to ensure proper dose for optimal extraction.

3.title: Distribute and Tamp
3.description: Level the coffee in the portafilter and tamp evenly with ~30lb pressure. Uniform tamping avoids channeling and supports even extraction.

4.title: Brew the Shot
4.description: Lock the portafilter and start brewing. Aim for ~30ml of espresso in 25–30 seconds at 9 bar pressure and 90–96°C water temperature.

5.title: Observe and Stop
5.description: Stop the shot when the espresso reaches ~30ml and the flow begins to lighten. A properly timed shot has balanced flavor and a rich crema.

6.title: Serve and Clean
6.description: Serve immediately in the preheated cup. Knock out the puck, rinse the portafilter, and purge the group head for the next shot.

1.title: Preheat Cup and Water
1.description: Warm the serving cup with hot water and discard it. Ensure hot water (90–95°C) is ready for dilution to maintain proper temperature.

2.title: Prepare Espresso Shot
2.description: Pull an espresso shot using the size you selected: small 30ml, medium 60ml, large 90ml. Follow the standard espresso preparation steps: grind, dose, tamp, and brew.

3.title: Add Hot Water to Cup
3.description: Pour the correct volume of hot water (90ml small, 150ml medium, 210ml large) into the preheated cup before adding espresso to preserve crema.

4.title: Combine Espresso and Water
4.description: Gently pour the espresso over the hot water. Avoid vigorous stirring to maintain crema, adjusting water if necessary for taste.

5.title: Serve Immediately
5.description: Serve while hot, as Americano cools faster due to the added water.

name: Macchiato
notes: Espresso with a small amount of milk foam.

1.title: Preheat Equipment and Cup
1.description: Warm the cup and espresso machine group head with hot water to maintain espresso temperature and crema.

2.title: Pull Espresso Shot
2.description: Grind fresh coffee and brew espresso according to your selected size: 30ml, 60ml, or 90ml.

3.title: Steam and Froth Milk
3.description: Steam a small quantity of milk to create fine foam. Use milk foam volumes matching size: 10ml small, 20ml medium, 30ml large.

4.title: Top Espresso with Foam
4.description: Gently spoon the milk foam onto the espresso shot to create the characteristic 'stain' (macchiato).

5.title: Serve Immediately
5.description: Serve in the preheated cup promptly to enjoy proper aroma and temperature.

name: Cappuccino
notes: Equal parts espresso, steamed milk, and foam.

1.title: Preheat Equipment and Cup
1.description: Flush hot water through machine and cup to maintain temperature during brewing.

2.title: Brew Espresso Shot
2.description: Brew espresso for your selected size: 30ml small, 60ml medium, 90ml large.

3.title: Steam Milk
3.description: Steam milk to 60°C, creating thick froth. Use volumes according to size: 60/120/180ml for steamed milk and foam.

4.title: Pour Milk and Foam
4.description: Pour steamed milk evenly over espresso, then spoon milk foam on top to create a balanced cappuccino.

5.title: Serve Immediately
5.description: Serve promptly to enjoy crema, milk texture, and aroma.

name: Latte
notes: Creamy espresso drink with lots of steamed milk.

1.title: Preheat Equipment and Cup
1.description: Warm cup and espresso machine group head with hot water.

2.title: Brew Espresso Shot
2.description: Pull espresso shot according to size: 30ml small, 60ml medium, 90ml large.

3.title: Steam Milk
3.description: Steam milk to 60°C. Use volumes: 150/240/330ml. Keep small layer of foam: 10/20/30ml.

4.title: Pour Milk Over Espresso
4.description: Gently pour steamed milk over espresso while holding back foam, then add the small foam layer on top.

5.title: Serve Immediately
5.description: Serve while hot to preserve aroma and texture.

name: Flat White
notes: Strong coffee-to-milk ratio with silky microfoam.

1.title: Preheat Equipment and Cup
1.description: Flush hot water through machine and cup to maintain temperature.

2.title: Brew Espresso Shot
2.description: Prepare espresso shot: 30/60/90ml depending on size.

3.title: Steam Microfoam Milk
3.description: Steam milk to create velvety microfoam matching volumes: 120/180/240ml.

4.title: Pour Milk Evenly
4.description: Pour microfoam milk over espresso, mixing evenly, with minimal foam on top.

5.title: Serve Immediately
5.description: Serve promptly to enjoy texture and aroma.

name: Iced Coffee
notes: Regular brewed coffee served cold over ice.

1.title: Brew Coffee
1.description: Use drip or pour-over method to brew coffee. Use the volume corresponding to size: 150/200/250ml.

2.title: Cool Coffee Slightly
2.description: Allow brewed coffee to cool to prevent rapid ice melt which dilutes the drink.

4.title: Combine Coffee and Milk
4.description: Pour coffee over ice, then add milk: 30/60/90ml depending on size. Stir gently.

name: Cold Brew
notes: Slow-steeped cold coffee diluted to taste.

1.title: Prepare Cold Brew Concentrate
1.description: Coarsely grind coffee beans (≈1:8 ratio) and steep in cold water for 12–24 hours. Strain before use.

2.title: Fill Glass with Ice
2.description: Add ice to glass according to size: 80/100/120ml.

3.title: Combine Concentrate and Dilution
3.description: Mix cold brew concentrate with water or milk in equal proportion: 80/100/120ml each for small/medium/large.

4.title: Serve Chilled
4.description: Serve immediately over ice for a refreshing cold brew.

name: Nitro Cold Brew
notes: Nitrogen-infused cold brew with creamy texture.

1.title: Prepare Cold Brew Concentrate
1.description: Make or use pre-prepared cold brew concentrate.

2.title: Infuse with Nitrogen
2.description: Use a nitro tap or canister to infuse nitrogen into the cold brew.

3.title: Pour and Serve
3.description: Pour nitro cold brew into glass without stirring. Serve chilled for creamy texture.

name: Iced Latte
notes: Espresso poured over milk and ice.

2.title: Add Ice to Glass
2.description: Fill glass with ice cubes: 80/100/120ml depending on size.

3.title: Pour Espresso Over Ice
3.description: Add freshly brewed espresso over ice to preserve flavor.

4.title: Add Cold Milk
4.description: Pour cold milk according to size: 120/180/240ml.

name: Frappuccino
notes: Blended iced coffee with milk and syrup.

1.title: Prepare Coffee
1.description: Brew espresso or instant coffee and allow it to cool.

2.title: Combine Ingredients in Blender
2.description: Add coffee, milk, syrup/sugar, and crushed ice to blender according to size.

4.title: Serve
4.description: Pour into a glass and optionally top with whipped cream.

name: Turkish Coffee
notes: Thick, unfiltered coffee brewed in a cezve.

1.title: Add Ingredients to Cezve
1.description: Place 7g finely ground coffee, 70ml water, and 5g sugar into the cezve.

2.title: Stir and Heat
2.description: Stir the mixture, then heat slowly over low heat until it foams just before boiling.

3.title: Pour and Settle
3.description: Pour into cup and allow grounds to settle. Serve without filtering.

name: Arabic Coffee
notes: Light roast coffee with cardamom, traditionally unsweetened.

1.title: Add Ingredients to Pot
1.description: Place lightly roasted coffee and cardamom into a small pot with 100ml water.

2.title: Simmer Slowly
2.description: Bring slowly to a simmer over low heat. Avoid boiling.

3.title: Pour and Serve
3.description: Pour carefully into cups and serve hot without sugar.

name: Vietnamese Coffee
notes: Strong, sweet coffee often served iced.

1.title: Prepare Vietnamese Drip
1.description: Place ground coffee into a Vietnamese drip filter (phin) over a cup.

2.title: Brew Coffee
2.description: Pour hot water (50/60/80ml) over coffee and allow to drip slowly.

3.title: Add Condensed Milk
3.description: Mix with condensed milk (25/30/40ml) to taste.

4.title: Serve Hot or Iced
4.description: Serve hot, or pour over ice for iced version.

name: Greek Coffee
notes: Unfiltered coffee brewed in a briki with foam ('kaimaki').

1.title: Add Ingredients to Briki
1.description: Place 7g finely ground coffee, 70ml water, and 5g sugar into a briki.

2.title: Heat Slowly
2.description: Stir and heat slowly until foam forms but before boiling.

3.title: Pour and Preserve Foam
3.description: Pour carefully into small cup preserving the foam ('kaimaki'). Serve without filtering.

name: Cuban Coffee
notes: Espresso whipped with sugar into espuma.

2.title: Whip Sugar with Espresso
2.description: Mix sugar with first drops of espresso to create foamy espuma.

3.title: Combine and Serve
3.description: Pour remaining espresso over whipped sugar and serve immediately.

name: Irish Coffee
notes: Coffee with whiskey, sugar, and cream float.

1.title: Prepare Coffee
1.description: Brew 120ml of hot coffee and pour into warmed glass.

2.title: Add Sugar
2.description: Stir in 10g brown sugar until dissolved.

4.title: Float Cream
4.description: Lightly whip 30ml cream and float on top.
